availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Richard W. McReynolds (U.S. Army lieutenant, captain, 1st Ky Lt Artil.; Illinois native)

body.p: Kentucky soldier. Illinois native. Son of John McReynolds. Married to Minta Hood McReynolds. Father of Lottie B. McReynolds. Resident of Edgar County, Illinois, in 1850. Served in the 1st Kentucky Light Artillery Regiment (U.S.A.) as first lieutenant, lieutenant, and captain from October 10, 1863, to July 26, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Illinois, Edgar County, District 19, p. 203A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jessamine County, Nicholasville, District 5, p. 92B.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0148.
Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates – Microfilm (1911-1964), KDLA, Roll #7020686, All County Deaths, File #27116, p. 1638 of 3031 of microfilm.
Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates – Microfilm (1911-1964), KDLA, Roll #7016226, All County Deaths, File #1628, p. 1635 of 3311 of microfilm.
Find A Grave, "Richard W McReynolds (1844-1920)," Memorial #174896006, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/174896006 (accessed January 14, 2021).
